name: Parameter
description: The Parameter DAT outputs a table of parameter names and values of an operator, including custom parameters, from any OP type.
summary: The Parameter DAT outputs a table of parameter names and values of an operator, including custom parameters, from any OP type.

parameters.name: Operators
parameters.label: Operators
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The Parameter  outputs a table of parameter names and values of an operator, including custom parameters, from any OP type. 
It can output pre-evaluated expressions, the Parameter Mode plus all attributes that define parameters - their type, label, ranges, menu items, limits, etc. in up to 24 columns of information.
parameterDAT_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 




  ops - The operators determine where to obtain the channels. Specify or more operator names or paths. Examples: wave1, slider*, constant[1-9] constant[10-19:2], ../base1. Or select the operators using the menu.



  parameters - The list of parameters names (which can include wildcards) you want to get from the (s). One or more parameter, or * for all parameters. You can also specify a "NOT" selection with an ^. Or select the parameter using the menu. See Pattern Matching.



  includeopname - Adds the OP name to the beginning of each parameter name in the table



  renamefrom - See Pattern Matching.



  renameto - See Pattern Expansion.



  custom - Output the operators' custom parameters.



  builtin - Output the operators' built-in parameters.





Toggles for information about the parameter and its value

  header - Outputs the column headers.



  name - Outputs the parameter name.



  value - Outputs the evaluated parameter value.



  eval - Outputs the evaluated parameter value as a python object.



  constant - Outputs the current constant value of the parameter.



  expression - Outputs the current python expression of the parameter.



  export - Outputs the export path of the parameter.



  mode - Outputs the current mode of the parameter (constant, expression, or export).



  style - Outputs what format the parameter is (eg. Float for float parameters, Menu for menu parameters etc.).



  tupletname - Outputs the name of the tuplet the parameter is in. For example, tx on the Geometry  is a part of the 't' tuplet.



  size - Outputs the size of the tuplet. For example, tx on the Geometry  would have a tuplet size of 3 since it's a part of the 't' tuplet with 3 parameters.



  path - Outputs the path to the node.



  menuindex - If the parameter is a menu, then output the selected index of the menu.





Toggles for information that define the parameter.

  minmax - Outputs the minimum and maximum values of the parameter. These values will clamp the value parameter to be within the range. If clampmin is 0 then the minimum will not clamp and the row/column entry will be 0. If clampmax is 0 then the maximum will not clamp and the row/column entry will be 1.



  clampminmax - Outputs whether or not the parameter has a clamped min or clamped max. If true, then the values are defined by min/max columns.



  normminmax - Outputs the minimum and maximum values of the parameter in the interface (ie. the minimum and maximum values of a slider).



  default - Outputs the default value of the parameter



  enabled - Outputs whether the parameter is currently enabled



  readonly - Outputs whether the parameter is currently read-only



  section - Outputs whether the parameter has a section divider/separator (ie. line) above it.



  menunames - Outputs a list of the menu names for any menu parameters.



  menulabels - Outputs a list of the menu labels for any menu parameters.





  language -  - Select how the  decides which script language to operate on.

 input - The  uses the inputs script language. node - The  uses it's own script language.

  extension -  - Select the file extension this  should expose to external editors.

 dat - various common file extensions. language - pick extension from DATs script language. custom - Specify a custom extension.

  customext - Specifiy the custom extension.



  wordwrap -  - Enable Word Wrap for Node Display.

 input - The  uses the inputs setting. on - Turn on Word Wrap. off - Turn off Word Wrap.

TouchDesigner Build: Latest\n2021.100002019.146502018.28070
DATs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



Any of the procedural data operators. OPs do all the work in TouchDesigner. They "cook" and output data to other OPs, which ultimately result in new images, data and audio being generated. See Node.



A text string that contains data (string, float, list, boolean, etc.) and operators (+ * < etc) that are evaluated by the node's language (python or Tscript) and returns a string, float list or boolean, etc. Expressions are used in parameters, DATs and in scripts.



Exporting is the connection of CHOP channels to parameters of operators. The output of each exporting CHOP is one or more channels, active only while the CHOP Viewer is on. The current value of a channel can be exported to a parameter of any operator, overriding that parameter's value. See Parameter.



A tuplet is the set of parameters that appear on one line of the parameter dialog. Tuplets occupy a page of parameters.



An Operator Family that contains its own Network. There are sixteen 3D Object Component and ten 2D Panel Component types. See also Network Path.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



The generic thing that holds an Operator, and includes Flags (display, bypass, lock, render, immune) and its position/size in the network. Whether you "lay down an Operator" or "lay down an Node", you're doing the same thing.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Parameter_DAT&oldid=16166"
		Category: DATs
